description: Promotes a read replica DB instance to a standalone DB instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The DB instance identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string. Constraints: Must match the identifier of an existing read replica DB instance. Example: mydbinstance.

parameters.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days for which automated backups are retained. Setting this parameter to a positive number enables backups. Setting this parameter to 0 disables automated backups. Default: 1 Constraints: Must be a value from 0 to 35. Can't be set to 0 if the DB instance is a source to read replicas.

parameters.name: PreferredBackupWindow
parameters.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, using the BackupRetentionPeriod parameter. The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time for each Amazon Web Services Region. To see the time blocks available, see Adjusting the Preferred Maintenance Window in the Amazon RDS User Guide. Constraints: Must be in the format hh24:mi-hh24:mi. Must be in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window. Must be at least 30 minutes.

nested_items.name: DBInstance
nested_items.description: Contains the details of an Amazon RDS DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The user-supplied database identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceClass
nested_items.description: The name of the compute and memory capacity class of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The database engine used for this DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of this database.

nested_items.name: AutomaticRestartTime
nested_items.description: The time when a stopped DB instance is restarted automatically.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: The master username for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBName
nested_items.description: The initial database name that you provided (if required) when you created the DB instance. This name is returned for the life of your DB instance. For an RDS for Oracle CDB instance, the name identifies the PDB rather than the CDB.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: Specifies the DNS address of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The amount of storage in gibibytes (GiB) allocated for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceCreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the DB instance was created.

nested_items.name: PreferredBackupWindow
nested_items.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days for which automatic DB snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: DBSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of DB security group elements containing DBSecurityGroup.Name and DBSecurityGroup.Status subelements.
ModifyDBInstance.
RebootDBInstance.
RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.
RestoreDBInstanceToPointInTime.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The list of Amazon EC2 VPC security groups that the DB instance belongs to.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The membership status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: DBParameterGroups
nested_items.description: The list of DB parameter groups applied to this DB instance.
CreateDBInstance.
CreateDBInstanceReadReplica.
DeleteDBInstance.
ModifyDBInstance.
RebootDBInstance.
RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone where the DB instance is located.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroup
nested_items.description: Information about the subnet group associated with the DB instance, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the DB subnet group.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupDescription
nested_items.description: Provides the description of the DB subnet group.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: Provides the VpcId of the DB subnet group.

nested_items.name: SubnetGroupStatus
nested_items.description: Provides the status of the DB subnet group.

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: Contains a list of Subnet elements. The list of subnets shown here might not reflect the current state of your VPC. For the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking your VPC configuration directly.

nested_items.name: SubnetIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the subnet.

nested_items.name: SubnetAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Contains Availability Zone information.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: SubnetOutpost
nested_items.description: If the subnet is associated with an Outpost, this value specifies the Outpost.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

nested_items.name: SubnetStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the subnet.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB subnet group.

nested_items.name: SupportedNetworkTypes
nested_items.description: The network type of the DB subnet group.
IPV4
DUAL.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: Information about pending changes to the DB instance. This information is returned only when there are pending changes. Specific changes are identified by subelements.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceClass
nested_items.description: The name of the compute and memory capacity class for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The allocated storage size for the DB instance specified in gibibytes (GiB).

nested_items.name: MasterUserPassword
nested_items.description: The master credentials for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days for which automated backups are retained.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Single-AZ DB instance will change to a Multi-AZ deployment.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The database engine version.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: The license model for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The Provisioned IOPS value for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The database identifier for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: CACertificateIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the CA certificate for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The DB subnet group for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: PendingCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of the log types whose configuration is still pending. In other words, these log types are in the process of being activated or deactivated.

nested_items.name: LogTypesToEnable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being deactivated. After they are deactivated, these log types aren't exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogTypesToDisable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being enabled. After they are enabled, these log types are exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProcessorFeatures
nested_items.description: The number of CPU cores and the number of threads per core for the DB instance class of the DB instance.
CreateDBInstance.
ModifyDBInstance.
RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.
RestoreDBInstanceFromS3
RestoreDBInstanceToPointInTime.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled.

nested_items.name: AutomationMode
nested_items.description: The automation mode of the RDS Custom DB instance: full or all-paused. If full, the DB instance automates monitoring and instance recovery. If all-paused, the instance pauses automation for the duration set by --resume-full-automation-mode-minutes.

nested_items.name: ResumeFullAutomationModeTime
nested_items.description: The number of minutes to pause the automation. When the time period ends, RDS Custom resumes full automation. The minimum value is 60 (default). The maximum value is 1,440.

nested_items.name: StorageThroughput
nested_items.description: The storage throughput of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The database engine of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DedicatedLogVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance has a dedicated log volume (DLV) enabled.>

nested_items.name: MultiTenant
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance will change to the multi-tenant configuration (TRUE) or the single-tenant configuration (FALSE).

nested_items.name: LatestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: The latest time to which a database in this DB instance can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. This setting doesn't apply to RDS Custom DB instances.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the database engine.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: Indicates whether minor version patches are applied automatically.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaSourceDBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the source DB instance if this DB instance is a read replica.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaDBInstanceIdentifiers
nested_items.description: The identifiers of the read replicas associated with this DB instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaDBClusterIdentifiers
nested_items.description: The identifiers of Aurora DB clusters to which the RDS DB instance is replicated as a read replica. For example, when you create an Aurora read replica of an RDS for MySQL DB instance, the Aurora MySQL DB cluster for the Aurora read replica is shown. This output doesn't contain information about cross-Region Aurora read replicas.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ReplicaMode
nested_items.description: The open mode of a Db2 or an Oracle read replica. The default is open-read-only. For more information, see Working with read replicas for Amazon RDS for Db2 and Working with read replicas for Amazon RDS for Oracle in the Amazon RDS User Guide.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: The license model information for this DB instance. This setting doesn't apply to Amazon Aurora or RDS Custom DB instances.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The Provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: OptionGroupMemberships
nested_items.description: The list of option group memberships for this DB instance.

nested_items.name: OptionGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the option group that the instance belongs to.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the DB instance's option group membership. Valid values are: in-sync, pending-apply, pending-removal, pending-maintenance-apply, pending-maintenance-removal, applying, removing, and failed.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: If present, specifies the name of the character set that this instance is associated with.

nested_items.name: NcharCharacterSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the NCHAR character set for the Oracle DB instance. This character set specifies the Unicode encoding for data stored in table columns of type NCHAR, NCLOB, or NVARCHAR2.

nested_items.name: SecondaryAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: If present, specifies the name of the secondary Availability Zone for a DB instance with multi-AZ support.

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance is publicly accessible.

nested_items.name: StatusInfos
nested_items.description: The status of a read replica. If the DB instance isn't a read replica, the value is blank.

nested_items.name: StatusType
nested_items.description: This value is currently 'read replication.'

nested_items.name: Normal
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is operating normally (TRUE) or is in an error state (FALSE).

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the DB instance. For a StatusType of read replica, the values can be replicating, replication stop point set, replication stop point reached, error, stopped, or terminated.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Details of the error if there is an error for the instance. If the instance isn't in an error state, this value is blank.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type associated with the DB instance.

nested_items.name: TdeCredentialArn
nested_items.description: The ARN from the key store with which the instance is associated for TDE encryption.

nested_items.name: DbInstancePort
nested_items.description: The port that the DB instance listens on. If the DB instance is part of a DB cluster, this can be a different port than the DB cluster port.

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: If the DB instance is a member of a DB cluster, indicates the name of the DB cluster that the DB instance is a member of.

nested_items.name: StorageEncrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If StorageEncrypted is enabled, the Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for the encrypted DB instance.

nested_items.name: DbiResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the DB instance. This identifier is found in Amazon Web Services CloudTrail log entries whenever the Amazon Web Services KMS key for the DB instance is accessed.

nested_items.name: CACertificateIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the CA certificate for this DB instance.

nested_items.name: DomainMemberships
nested_items.description: The Active Directory Domain membership records associated with the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Domain
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Active Directory Domain.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Active Directory Domain membership for the DB instance or cluster. Values include joined, pending-join, failed, and so on.

nested_items.name: FQDN
nested_items.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Active Directory Domain.

nested_items.name: IAMRoleName
nested_items.description: The name of the IAM role used when making API calls to the Directory Service.

nested_items.name: OU
nested_items.description: The Active Directory organizational unit for the DB instance or cluster.

nested_items.name: AuthSecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the Secrets Manager secret with the credentials for the user that's a member of the domain.

nested_items.name: DnsIps
nested_items.description: The IPv4 DNS IP addresses of the primary and secondary Active Directory domain controllers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
nested_items.description: Indicates whether tags are copied from the DB instance to snapshots of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: MonitoringInterval
nested_items.description: The interval, in seconds, between points when Enhanced Monitoring metrics are collected for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: EnhancedMonitoringResourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log stream that receives the Enhanced Monitoring metrics data for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: MonitoringRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS to send Enhanced Monitoring metrics to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: PromotionTier
nested_items.description: The order of priority in which an Aurora Replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance. For more information, see Fault Tolerance for an Aurora DB Cluster in the Amazon Aurora User Guide.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Timezone
nested_items.description: The time zone of the DB instance. In most cases, the Timezone element is empty. Timezone content appears only for RDS for Db2 and RDS for SQL Server DB instances that were created with a time zone specified.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DatabaseInsightsMode
nested_items.description: The mode of Database Insights that is enabled for the instance.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Performance Insights is enabled for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsKMSKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for encryption of Performance Insights data.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days to retain Performance Insights data.
month * 31, where month is a number of months from 1-23. Examples: 93 (3 months * 31), 341 (11 months * 31), 589 (19 months * 31)

nested_items.name: EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of log types that this DB instance is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProcessorFeatures
nested_items.description: The number of CPU cores and the number of threads per core for the DB instance class of the DB instance.
CreateDBInstance.
ModifyDBInstance.
RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.
RestoreDBInstanceFromS3
RestoreDBInstanceToPointInTime.

nested_items.name: DeletionProtection
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance has deletion protection enabled. The database can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled. For more information, see Deleting a DB Instance.

nested_items.name: AssociatedRoles
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles associated with the DB instance.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that is associated with the DB instance.

nested_items.name: FeatureName
nested_items.description: The name of the feature associated with the Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. For information about supported feature names, see DBEngineVersion.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Information about the state of association between the IAM role and the DB instance. The Status property returns one of the following values:
ACTIVE - the IAM role ARN is associated with the DB instance and can be used to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.
PENDING - the IAM role ARN is being associated with the DB instance.
INVALID - the IAM role ARN is associated with the DB instance, but the DB instance is unable to assume the IAM role in order to access other Amazon Web Services services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: ListenerEndpoint
nested_items.description: The listener connection endpoint for SQL Server Always On.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: Specifies the DNS address of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

nested_items.name: MaxAllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The upper limit in gibibytes (GiB) to which Amazon RDS can automatically scale the storage of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: TagList
nested_items.description: A list of tags.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: DBInstanceAutomatedBackupsReplications
nested_items.description: The list of replicated automated backups associated with the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceAutomatedBackupsArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replicated automated backups.

nested_items.name: CustomerOwnedIpEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a customer-owned IP address (CoIP) is enabled for an RDS on Outposts DB instance.

nested_items.name: AwsBackupRecoveryPointArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recovery point in Amazon Web Services Backup.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier used for encrypting messages in the database activity stream. The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier is the key ARN, key ID, alias ARN, or alias name for the KMS key.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamKinesisStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Kinesis data stream used for the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamMode
nested_items.description: The mode of the database activity stream. Database events such as a change or access generate an activity stream event. RDS for Oracle always handles these events asynchronously.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamEngineNativeAuditFieldsIncluded
nested_items.description: Indicates whether engine-native audit fields are included in the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: AutomationMode
nested_items.description: The automation mode of the RDS Custom DB instance: full or all paused. If full, the DB instance automates monitoring and instance recovery. If all paused, the instance pauses automation for the duration set by --resume-full-automation-mode-minutes.

nested_items.name: ResumeFullAutomationModeTime
nested_items.description: The number of minutes to pause the automation. When the time period ends, RDS Custom resumes full automation. The minimum value is 60 (default). The maximum value is 1,440.

nested_items.name: CustomIamInstanceProfile
nested_items.description: The instance profile associated with the underlying Amazon EC2 instance of an RDS Custom DB instance. The instance profile must meet the following requirements:
The profile must exist in your account.
The profile must have an IAM role that Amazon EC2 has permissions to assume.
The instance profile name and the associated IAM role name must start with the prefix AWSRDSCustom.

nested_items.name: BackupTarget
nested_items.description: The location where automated backups and manual snapshots are stored: Dedicated Local Zones, Amazon Web Services Outposts or the Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: The network type of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamPolicyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the policy state of the activity stream.

nested_items.name: StorageThroughput
nested_items.description: The storage throughput for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBSystemId
nested_items.description: The Oracle system ID (Oracle SID) for a container database (CDB). The Oracle SID is also the name of the CDB. This setting is only valid for RDS Custom DB instances.

nested_items.name: MasterUserSecret
nested_items.description: The secret managed by RDS in Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager for the master user password.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret.

nested_items.name: SecretStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the secret.
creating - The secret is being created.
active - The secret is available for normal use and rotation.
rotating - The secret is being rotated.

impaired - The secret can be used to access database credentials, but it can't be rotated. A secret might have this status if, for example, permissions are changed so that RDS can no longer access either the secret or the KMS key for the secret. When a secret has this status, you can correct the condition that caused the status. Alternatively, modify the DB instance to turn off automatic management of database credentials, and then modify the DB instance again to turn on automatic management of database credentials.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the secret.

nested_items.name: CertificateDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: CAIdentifier
nested_items.description: The CA identifier of the CA certificate used for the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: ValidTill
nested_items.description: The expiration date of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaSourceDBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the source DB cluster if this DB instance is a read replica.

nested_items.name: PercentProgress
nested_items.description: The progress of the storage optimization operation as a percentage.

nested_items.name: DedicatedLogVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance has a dedicated log volume (DLV) enabled.

nested_items.name: IsStorageConfigUpgradeAvailable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether an upgrade is recommended for the storage file system configuration on the DB instance. To migrate to the preferred configuration, you can either create a blue/green deployment, or create a read replica from the DB instance. For more information, see Upgrading the storage file system for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MultiTenant
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the DB instance is in the multi-tenant configuration (TRUE) or the single-tenant configuration (FALSE).

nested_items.name: EngineLifecycleSupport
nested_items.description: The lifecycle type for the DB instance.
